address.description:
An address that can be used within the Andromeda ecosystem. Inspired by the cosmwasm-std `Addr` type. [Link to CosmWasm Addr](https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/2a1c698520a1aacedfe3f4803b0d7d653892217a/packages/std/src/addresses.rs#L33)

This address can be one of two things: 1. A valid human-readable address e.g., `cosmos1...` 2. A valid Andromeda VFS path e.g., `/home/user/app/component`

VFS paths can be local in the case of an app and can be done by referencing `./component`. They can also contain protocols for cross-chain communication. A VFS path is usually structured as follows:

`<protocol>://<chain (required if IBC used)>/<path>` or `ibc://cosmoshub-4/user/app/component`
